name: First Care Activating Serum for Anti-Aging
about: What it is: A first step serum that helps strengthen skin barrier while improving visible signs of aging...Skin Type: Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily..Skincare Concerns: Fine Lines and Wrinkles, Dullness, Dryness, Redness, Uneven Texture, Oiliness and Loss of Firmness and Elasticity..Formulation: Lightweight Serum..Highlighted Ingredients:.- Sulwhasoo Master Complex™: Helps improve skin hydration, radiance, soothing and anti-aging.- Vitamin C Derivative: A stable form of Vitamin C to deliver potent antioxidant benefits..Ingredient Callouts: Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, and hydroquinone...What Else You Need to Know: A first of its kind activating serum enriched with ginseng and Korean herb extracts, designed to strengthen your moisture barrier post-cleanse to boost absorption of products that follow. Immediately after use, it helps activates skin’s radiance for instant glow while providing lasting hydration...Clinical Results: Based on an 8-week clinical study on 30 women 39 to 60, visible improvements after 4 weeks of use include:.- Elasticity +5.9%.- Moisture barriers strengthening +9.9%.- Hydration +14.5%..Based on a 4-week independent consumer study on 600 women ages 25 to 39 after 4 weeks of use:.- 96% Agreed their skin texture feels smoother.- 93% agreed their skin looks healthy.- 92% agreed their skin looks clear and bright
ingredients: -Sulwhasoo Master Complex™: A combination of herbal ingredients and ginseng that.activates the skin’s potential and supports skin’s natural abilities. ..﻿Water / Aqua / Eau, Alcohol Denat., Butylene Glycol, Betaine, 1,2-Hexanediol, .Bis-Peg-18 Methyl Ether Dimethyl Silane, Glyceryl Polymethacrylate, Propanediol, Carbomer, Ppg-13-Decyltetradeceth-24, Tromethamine, Glyceryl Caprylate,  Scutellaria Baicalensis Root Extract, Ethylhexylglycerin, Fragrance / Parfum, Adenosine, Limonene, Dextrin, Theobroma Cacao (Cocoa) Extract, Methyl Trimethicone, Disodium Edta, Xanthan Gum, Cellulose Gum, Carrageenan, Honey / Mel / Miel, Madecassoside, Rehmannia Glutinosa Root Extract, Pentylene Glycol, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, 3-O-Ethyl Ascorbic Acid, Taurine, Ophiopogon Japonicus Root Extract, Paeonia Lactiflora Root Extract, Lilium Candidum Bulb Extract, Linalool, Polygonatum Odoratum Rhizome Extract, Biosaccharide Gum-1, Propylene Glycol, Panax Ginseng Root Extract, Nelumbo Nucifera Flower Extract, Natto Gum, Ziziphus Jujuba Fruit Extract, Juglans Regia (Walnut) Seed Extract, Prunus Mume Fruit Extract, Citronellol, Citral, Geraniol,  Hydrogenated Lecithin, Tocopherol, Citric Acid.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.Designed to be your first step post-cleanse. After your morning and evening cleansing ritual, apply three pumps to damp skin with your fingertips and press serum into skin with an open palm for increased absorption.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Deep skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Sulwhasoo’s First Care Activating Serum is a luxurious addition to any skincare routine, especially for those focused on anti-aging. As a beauty enthusiast, I’ve tried many serums, but this one truly stands out. From the first use, I noticed how quickly it absorbed into my skin, leaving it feeling smooth, hydrated, and refreshed.  This serum is a game-changer for boosting overall skin health. Over time, I’ve seen a visible improvement in my skin’s texture, tone, and elasticity. It provides a radiant glow that makes my skin look youthful and well-rested. The lightweight formula layers beautifully under other products without pilling, making it an excellent first step in my routine.  The herbal scent adds a touch of luxury to the experience, and I appreciate the focus on traditional Korean herbal medicine. While the price is on the higher side, the results make it worth the investment.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I got a free sample of this from Sephora and I was told my skin is glowing. I love the smell, texture all of it. I fear it is worth the $, I will purchase.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I’m a first timer using Sulwhasoo  corean skin care products. And my experience being able to use it as a beauty  enthusiast With a mature skin I have to say that I’m very pleased with this serum , when you apply the serum it sinks in right away. I feel as the alcohol in this formulation is helping the ingredients penetrate more deeply. If you aren’t a fan of alcohol, you can stay away from this. Alcohol can dehydrate  skin, but Sulwhasoo seems to have included some deeply hydrating ingredients to counteract this effect. I did some research, and the effect of alcohol on skin has actually be studied quite a bit and they’ve found no real negative side effects, long or short term. But i don’t need research to know this serum makes my skin feel so healthy. The results is a velvet, beautiful texture that sinks in to the skin leaving you feeling refresh and hydrated. The scent is  herbal-ish but light, it fades after a few seconds and i don’t minded.  It doesn't irritate the skin at all, it doesn't leave it greasy, once it dries it seems like I haven't applied anything. My skin feels hydrated and I feel like it's too soon to say if I've noticed any other changes besides hydration.

reviews.review_title: The Ultimate Boost for Your Skincare Routine
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: As a beauty enthusiast constantly on the lookout for the best products, I was searching for something to take my skincare regimen to the next level, and the Sulwhasoo First Care Activating Serum did not disappoint! This product has completely elevated my routine by enhancing the effectiveness of every product I apply after it. From serums to moisturizers, it works like a primer for your skincare, boosting their absorption and results.  The texture is incredibly lightweight, and it absorbs into the skin almost instantly, leaving it dry to the touch but still feeling deeply hydrated. It doesn’t feel greasy or sticky, making it perfect for layering. What I also love is the luxurious packaging, it’s not only gorgeous but also functional. The pump dispenser is precise and makes it easy to get just the right amount without any waste.  Using this serum feels like a spa-like ritual every time. It has a subtle, calming scent that adds to the overall experience. If you’re looking to take your skincare routine to a higher level and want something that delivers both immediate hydration and long-term benefits, this serum is worth every penny. It’s a must-have for anyone serious about skincare!  This review was collected as part of a promotion.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have tried so many serums in the past and none of them delivered as quickly as this serum. I have fine lines under my eyes and slight crows feet and I should have taken a before pic ( early 40’s). I’ve tried eye creams and several other creams and serums to try and diminish and slow the look of them. This serum within a couple of days made my eyes look so much better, when I smile my crows feet are dramatically softened. My under eyes look more hydrated and plumper. This alone has sold me, I will not ever run out of this after today. It has been a couple of weeks, I apply morning and night to my face and neck. My skin looks more youthful with and without makeup on and has this glowy radiance to it. This serum feels cool and is somewhat watery but at the same time has a slight tackiness to it. Once dry the skin feels very soft and smooth and you continue with the rest of your skincare routine. It has so many good ingredients such as ginseng, Korean herb extract and vitamin c. This is absolutely worth every penny if you are looking for aging prevent and hydration.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I personally think that this is an exceptional and innovative product. After only one week of use my skin have an enormous positive look than before. Is softer, smoother and hydrated. After I wash my face I apply two drops and my finger and pat in my skin , after that I apply moisturizer. The consistency it’s clear and has a subtle clean smell , it absorbs fast and don’t let any residue, This serum contains a blend of 5 herbs, including Ginseng to improve hydration, brightness, radiance, translucency, wrinkles and the moisture barrier. It has become an absolute necessity as the first step in my skincare routine and I planning to use it twice a day as part of my day and night routine .I definitely recommend this serum if you want to see fast improvement in your skin !

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, gray hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: As a huge beauty lover and a licensed cosmetologist, I can confidently tell you that Sulwhasoo's First Care Activating Serum VI will change the game. I could feel a change from the first use. It provides both a wonderful weightlessness and an intense splash of moisture. Immediately, my skin felt softer and more balanced, and eventually the evidence was irrefutable. I saw a noticeable brightening, smoothing, and evening of my skin tone after four weeks. It's not often that a product can actually fulfill its promise of handling multiple signs of aging! This is a serum that because of its formula makes everything you apply afterwards absorb into the skin better. It makes all the moisturizers and treatments work better, which in turn makes my entire routine more efficient. It smells incredibly calming and the application process (pressing it into your damp skin) is a mini self-care ritual in itself. This is the product you need to step up your skincare game. Highly recommend!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This SULWHASOO First Care Activating Serum VI is super lightweight and is absorbed very quickly into the skin. the purpose of the serum is to help all products applied afterwards work even better. I have only been using for a little bit so I can’t say for certain what the ultimate benefits will be from it. I imagine you have to use this for at least 30 days before seeing any real results. I have heard nothing but amazing things about this product so I look forward to continuing using it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I have been testing the Sulwhasoo First Care Activating Serum VI for a little over a week and it has really saved my skin as we are moving into cold dry weather. I take a small amount into my palms and press it into my skin and repeat that a few times before moving on to heavier layers of skincare. This has done a phenomenal job balancing my skin and helping keep dryness at bay. The texture is thin and lightweight and it comes with a generous amount of product. The bottle is weighted and luxurious which is an extra bonus to the high quality product within. Every morning since adding this into my nighttime routine I have noticed my skin is much more hydrated and soft. I couldn't be more pleased so far!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Fair skin tone, Dry skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, auburn hair, Porcelain skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have been using this product for a week, and it has become a staple in my skincare routine.   I like to use this as my first serum, after using a cleanser, a facial exfoliator, and a toner   I have thoroughly enjoyed using this serum. I have combination (leaning dry) skin, and it helps hydrate my face, leaving it with a healthy and radiant glow-from-within look that I absolutely love.   It can also be followed by other serums and a moisturizer as part of a complete skincare routine.   Plus, the minimalist packaging is absolutely gorgeous. I love how straightforward it is. Beauty in simplicity.   And, the pump is easy to as well. Just dispense a few pumps of this elegantly scented serum into your hand, and your good to go. You can easily apply it with your fingertips, as I do, or use your choice of applicators.   It absorbs into the skin quickly and evenly, and goes to work fast.   I highly recommend this product to everyone, even those with sensitive skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Combination skin

This serum contains a blend of 5 herbs, including Ginseng to improve hydration, brightness, radiance, translucency, wrinkles and the moisture barrier.  The consistency is watery with a relaxing, earthy scent. It absorbs easily into skin and I definitely feel an improvement in the smoothness of my skin. I was only given 7 days to test this product so I cannot speak to results but it does feel good and works well with all my other products. It sits well under makeup and doesn’t pill at all. I really like how it feels and that you don’t have to alternate the serum with other products.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brunette hair, Porcelain skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: As a skincare devotee, I've encountered countless products promising transformative results. However, Sulwhasoo's First Care Activating Serum VI stands out as a truly exceptional formulation that has exceeded my expectations.  This luxurious serum offers a multi-sensory experience. Its delicate ginseng is both soothing and invigorating, while its velvety texture glides effortlessly across the skin. The formula quickly absorbs, leaving my skin feeling hydrated and revitalized.  Within a mere seven days, I noticed a significant reduction in the appearance of my persistent frown line between my brows. This serum's potent blend of traditional Korean herbal ingredients works synergistically to nourish and protect the skin, promoting a radiant and youthful complexion.  Incorporating this exceptional serum into my daily skincare routine has become an indispensable part of my self-care regimen. Its luxurious texture, invigorating fragrance, and remarkable efficacy make it a must-have for anyone seeking a high-performance product that delivers visible results.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The Sulwhasoo First Care Activating Serum is an intriguing addition to any skincare routine, especially for those looking for an anti-aging boost. At first pump, the scent is quite distinct—reminiscent of a medicinal, almost dentist-office-like Novocain aroma. While the smell is strong, it doesn’t linger too long, which is a relief.  That said, the serum feels amazing on the skin. It absorbs quickly without any sticky residue, leaving a hydrated and slightly plumper feel. Over time, I’ve noticed a subtle improvement in my complexion—it appears a touch more radiant and healthy-looking.  One of the highlights is the packaging. The bottle is gorgeous, with a smooth matte finish that feels luxurious in hand and looks stunning on the vanity.  Overall, despite the strong scent, this serum delivers on its promise of improving skin texture and glow. If you can get past the fragrance, it’s a lovely product to incorporate into your regimen. This review was collected as part of a promotion.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Porcelain skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I am 27 years old with normal to dry skin. I have been using this Sulwashoo First Care Activating Serum VI for a little over a week. I am definitely seeing improvements in my skin!   Being young, I have thankfully not yet gotten wrinkles, but it is truly never too early to start using anti aging products.  The packaging is very high quality and the pump makes sense for the product. The serum is very thin and slippery in a good way as in its spreadable and you don't need to use a lot. It's definitely a plus that I don't have to use a lot on my face and that a little goes a long way. This had no scent to me.   As an addition to my routine, the Serum has helped to make my skin more moisturized and hydrated. I have noticed using my normal moisturizer after using the serum that my skin absorbs the moisturizer better as my skin feels immediately plump and stays hydrated longer. Visibly, my skin looks glowy and plump and it feels softer, too.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I love this product so much!! It is a must have in my skin care routine now!! I haven’t had any acne breakouts since using this and my acne scars look to be healing.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Gray eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: As a licensed cosmetologist and wellness enthusiast, I place a high value on quality, wholesome skincare. I recommend Sulwhasoo’s First Care Activating Serum VI to anyone who’s looking to improve the health of their skin. This serum goes above and beyond to hydrate and firm the skin while priming it for better moisture retention.  Due to immune system issues (internal technical difficulties), my face had an insatiable thirst that left me wanting more from my expansive skincare collection. First Care helped to fill the void.   I began using 2 pumps of the serum all over my face and an additional pump patted into my t-zone after cleansing with a hydrating wash. My skin quickly began to feel firmer and fresher.   I am still struggling with some dryness - due to lingering immune system issues - but my skin looks and feels younger. In a week’s time, I’ve seen drastic improvement and I cannot wait to restock during Black Friday. Whether you’re looking to resolve problematic skin issues or maintain your skin’s barrier and health, Sulwhasoo’s serum has beneficial qualities to meet a variety of needs.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is my first time ever using a skincare product that PREPS the skin for toners/essences for increased product absorption. Now that I have incorporated this into my routine I am never going back. Right when I get out of the shower or finish cleansing my skin, my skin can feel tight. However after using this serum before I even use my hydration mist my skin already feels so juicy and plump! There is also a noticeable glow and I have noticed after applying all of my skincare my makeup even sets better! The product has a texture that’s a mix between a serum and a facial oil which feels amazing! The fragrance smells very earthy and sweet. I feel like my skin holds onto moisture longer than before which I’m really happy about. The packaging of this product is top tier! It’s a nice solid glass (?) bottle that is not only aesthetically pleasing for a bathroom counter, but is also incredibly durable. The bottle is quite large and the product goes a long way. I am in love!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I was excited to try out Sulwhasoo First Care Activating Serum. I’m a big fan of K-Beauty, and It’s a brand and serum I have heard a lot about over the years but had not tried out myself. I find that the serum is quite unique. It does not replace your normal serum. Instead, you use it as the first skincare step after cleansing, and it helps to strengthen your skin barrier, lock in moisture, and help your other products work better. I really liked how this serum felt on my skin. It was lightweight and silky, absorbing quickly while also providing lasting hydration. reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, gray hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Before getting to test out the First Care Activating Serum VI by SULWHASOO, I had no idea the struggle I would go through. From this serum’s refreshing, Ginger scent to its superpowered humectant abilities, after only seven days of testing it out I practically wanted to bathe in it every day. The struggle was real not to OVERUSE this potent skincare.   I live in the Pacific Northwest, where humidity in the fall is super high.  This serums humectant ability worked seamlessly with this dense humidity by making my skin feel fresh and hydrated all day long. I even noticed that when I used this serum all by itself, my skin still felt comfortable and dewy. When I layered on other serums and moisturizers, my 42-year-old dry skin felt supremely plump and hydrated.   I also suffer from dry eczema spots on my hands and feet and after feeling just how hydrating this serum can be I thought I would test it on those spots. I was pleasantly surprised at how the dry spots on my skin felt less irritated and less reactive. After several days of using this serum on my face, my neck, my chest, my hands and my feet, I’m totally sold on its healing abilities.    Good luck not wanting to use it from head to toe.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: As a beauty enthusiast who loves to experiment with beauty products, I was delighted to discover the Sulwhasoo First Care Activating Serum, a lightweight hydrating serum. It was impressive to see how much research and technology went into this product, and it was well worth it because I could really feel the difference. The Sulwhasoo First Care Activating Serum has a lot of benefits, but the biggest one for me is its deep hydration—it left my skin feeling soft after just a few uses. Formulated with ginseng extract and vitamin C to brighten and balance the skin, the serum is super lightweight and has a light herbal scent that refreshes the senses. It absorbs quickly into the skin without causing irritation or leaving a sticky feeling. This serum has given my skin barrier a healthier glow, saying goodbye to dullness. This brand is known for combining traditional Korean herbal ingredients with an innovative approach to achieving high quality, and this serum has a gel texture that absorbs quickly and doesn’t leave my skin feeling sticky. It’s great for layering other products and as a primer before applying makeup! With a powerful ginseng ingredient, it has a fresh herbal scent that awakens my senses. If you’re looking for a high quality, gentle, and effective hydrating serum that delivers on its promise, look no further!

reviews.review_text: I'd never heard of Sulwhasoo before getting an opportunity to try it in exchange for an honest review! How did I even miss it? I've been an Esthetician for many years, shopped at Sephora forever, in addition to working at higher end department stores early in my career.  No matter, because now that I've found it, I'm not letting go!  The bottle itself is gorgeous, yet simple. The serum itself feels more like what you'd get in an ampule.  It's very thin, and not oily at all, just light and watery feeling.  It feels great on freshly cleansed skin, giving a feeling of instant hydration and energy.  It can be used am and pm, but I love using it again just prior to makeup or primer (it doesn't interfere at all).  Being slightly acne-prone, with aging skin , I'm impressed to see zero breakouts or congestion. What I do see is bouncy, supple skin that finally looks awake!  It helped with fine lines and uneven skin texture as well. My skin feels unbelievably smooth now that I've been using it regularly. I've tried it under all of my skincare, even retinol cream, with great results.  It makes everything you put over it work better!  This is a forever product for me!

reviews.review_text: I’d highly recommend Sulwhasoo’s First Care Activating Serum V to anyone looking to enhance their skincare routine. Its light fragrance is pleasant but subtle, adding a touch of luxury without being overwhelming. Applied three light pumps right after cleansing and before any other products, it preps the skin perfectly, gently opening pores to allow everything applied afterward to absorb deeply and effectively. The trick is to quickly follow up with other serums to lock in all the benefits — it’s like setting the stage for them to sink in perfectly. It is a must-try for those who love a well-absorbed, layered approach to skincare.

It’s impressive how much research and tech went into developing this product, and it’s totally worth it because I can really feel a difference. The Sulwhasoo First Care Activating Serum has a lot of benefits, but the biggest one for me is the deep hydration—it makes my skin feel so supple after just a few uses. I love that it leaves my skin feeling fresh without any residue, which makes it perfect for layering in my routine. I also feel like it helps the products I use afterward (like my vitamin C serum and cream) absorb better, as my skin looks noticeably brighter lately. The texture is a thin serum with a honey-like color, and it’s been making my dry, dehydrated skin look a lot more radiant. This is a fantastic addition to your routine if you’re looking to supercharge hydration, strengthen your skin barrier, or get more out of your other products. Bravo, Sulwhasoo—this product is wonderful. This review was collected as part of a promotion.

reviews.review_title: “My Day with Sulwhasoo’s First Care Serum
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This review was collected as part of a promotion. Using Sulwhasoo’s First Care Activating Serum has become one of the best steps in my skincare routine, and I can see why it’s been a woman’s favorite. The packaging is sleek and minimalistic, with a solid, high-quality feel that reflects Sulwhasoo’s luxury branding. The bottle itself is sturdy, and the pump dispenser makes it easy to control the amount I use. I’ve come to appreciate these small design details, as it keeps me from accidentally dispensing too much, which is a relief since this serum is on the pricier side. Right away, the experience felt high-end and well-thought-out, which is nice when I’m spending extra on skincare. When I first pumped the serum into my hand, I immediately noticed its amber tint and lightweight, almost watery texture. It spreads easily, and a little goes a long way. The scent is probably the most distinct aspect of this product—strong, herbal, and reminiscent of traditional Korean medicinal herbs, like ginseng. Initially, I was unsure if I’d like it because it’s quite potent, but I quickly grew to love it. The scent gives the experience a grounding, almost therapeutic feeling, and it reminds me that this product is packed with natural, herbal ingredients. Overall, the serum is surreal to be this good.

I like to thing about this serum, not as a traditional serum but more as a skincare activator.  This product is meant to be applied after you wash your face, (before you start your skincare routine.). Using the Sulwhasoo First Care Activating Serum prior to the rest of your skincare, will actually increase the efficacy of all other existing products in your routine.  It improves absorption, and hydration, thereby activating all of the products that are layered on the skin after it.  The fragrance is lovely and botanical, as it is meant to awaken the senses, and prepare you for a truly spa like experience.    After I apply this serum, I follow with an essence, a traditional serum and then my moisturizer.  This is a routine that I do twice a day after cleansing.  My dry, middle aged skin is smoother, brighter, supple and much more hydrated since discovering the Sulwhasoo First Care Activating Serum.  I highly recommend it to anyone looking to boost the efficacy of their existing skincare products or to level up their hydration game.

reviews.review_title: Glow Up! Sulwhasoo Serum Transforms Dry, Dull Skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: As someone with dry skin that could rival the Sahara, this little serum has become my desert oasis. I’ve got fine lines that seem to pop up overnight like unwanted guests, and let's not even get started on the general dullness. This serum made me feel like I upgraded my skin-care routine from amateur hour to luxury spa status.   First of all, I love that this is my first step after cleansing. The texture is light and silky, like my skin was getting a VIP treatment. The instructions said to apply three pumps and press it into damp skin—so I did, and wow! It didn’t just sit there awkwardly; it soaked in like it was on a mission to hydrate my soul. The ginseng and Korean herbs make me feel like I’m treating my face to some kind of ancient beauty ritual.   Now, don’t expect miracles overnight, but after a week, my skin went from dry desert to hydrated oasis. The fine lines? They didn’t vanish into thin air (I’m not a wizard), but they’ve definitely softened, like they’ve decided to chill out. My face is smoother, and there’s a noticeable bounce that wasn’t there before, like my skin’s had a pep talk.  The real kicker, though? The scent. It smells like you’ve just wandered into an upscale spa—this light, herbal fragrance that makes me feel like I’m doing something truly luxurious for myself. No overpowering perfume here, just enough to make me think, 'Yeah, I deserve this.'  Bonus points: my other skincare seems to absorb better now, so I feel like I’m getting more bang for my buck with everything.  If you have dry skin like me and are battling the fine line army, give this a go! This serum might just be your new skincare BFF. Sulwhasoo, you have earned a permanent spot on my vanity.

Sulwhasoo is a high-end skincare brand with active ingredients such as ginseng, herbs, and other natural botanicals. I love the light herbal fragrance and the perfect consistency of this serum; it absorbs in a flash without leaving any sticky residue. The elegant glass with a convenient pump offers both luxury and functionality by preventing waste. It is a first step in my skincare routine after cleansing that rejuvenates the skin and helps all the further products absorb better. Either way, whether I follow it with another serum or essence and then finish it off with a rich cream, it works beautifully. My skin is soft in the morning when I wake up, and if I used it this morning, it helped my skin moisturize longer than 8 hours or work. Well worth every penny for radiant skin!

It also feels firmer. My skin is glowing now! I use it every day following with a moisturizer. I like the texture of this serum and it’s perfect for my sensitive skin. My fine lines are a lot less obvious. I highly recommend giving it a try.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Sulwhasoo updated its classic formula with antioxidant ginseng to create First Care Activating Serum VI. This blend includes lotus, white lily, and Solomon's seal, which cosmetic chemist Ginger King says help with moisturization, soothing, and brightening, respectively. The serum can be absorbed very easily.

reviews.review_text: I love the way this makes my skin look and feel, I only wish the price wasn’t so high!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Sulwhasoo is one of my all time favorite skincare brands! This serum is my holy grail! It has a very luxurious, lightweight silky texture that glides on and absorbs easily without feeling greasy or tacky. I love that this helps my other skincare products I use after it, to absorb better. It’s incredibly hydrating, and nourishing. It helps with fine lines, wrinkles, firmness, loss of elasticity, texture, dryness, and strengthening the skin barrier. Perfect for morning and night and works great under makeup.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is the 'first step/base product' before many of the Sulwhasoo skincare rituals. I apply 2 pumps of this watery serum to my face and neck, which my skin drinks up immediately. It's not one of those that sits around waiting to be absorbed. I noticed a brightening effect within just a couple of days (especially when used before Snowise Brightening Water and Serum) and also a slight reduction in my skins' oil production - something I was not expecting. But I must mention the reduction is only slight, not huge and I still need to use blotting sheets by late afternoon time.   There's some really good 'herbal' ingredients in First Care Activating Serum, and unfortunately some really bad ones too. How's 'alcohol' for you, at second position on the ingredients list? Not to mention a ton of fragrance. Luckily I didn't experience any irritation or breakout, but I'm not confident I'd be saying the same thing if I was to use this long term. It's a shame, this product holds a lot of potential, with just a couple of minor adjustments to the ingredients it could be something truly special. Thankfully I decided to get this in the trial size, without investing in a full bottle.   ~ My Sephora Top 7 must-have list ~  (My top 7 must-have beauty products of all time, focusing mainly on my purchases at Sephora)  1. Hair Loss Treatment: ‘Divine Herbal’ - Hair Oil  2. Shampoo: 'Sephora Collection' - Deep Cleaning Shampoo 3. Face Mask: ‘Peter Thomas Roth’ – Pumpkin Enzyme Mask  4. Pigmentation + Anti-Aging Serum: ‘Divine Herbal’ - Facial Treatment Serum 5. Face Scrub: ‘Sisley' - Botanical Gentle Buffing Cream 6. Lip Balm: ‘Nuxe’ – Reve De Miel Lip Balm 7. Lip Liner: ‘Sephora Collection' - Rouge Gel Lip Liner

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love how my skin feels soft and plump after using. I don’t find this serum sticky and I do find it light weight. It absorbs pretty quickly into the skin but my guess is that could be due to the higher levels of alcohol denat/denatured alcohol. Because of how drying this ingredient can be for the skin barrier I’m not sure I could use this very often. I don’t mind this ingredient if it’s not listed within the first 7 ingredients of a product, but this is the second ingredient listed which likely means there are higher levels of it. This being said, I have not noticed skin sensitivity after use so I do feel like it is safe to use a few times a week. There is a scent but I don’t mind it. This serum contains ginseng which I love ! I do feel like my skin is less dull and more plump after use. I also like the minimalist / gender neutral packaging !

This serum is designed to be used as the first step in your skincare routine to enhance the effectiveness of subsequent products.  One of the key features of this serum is its blend of traditional Korean herbal ingredients, which are known for their nourishing and revitalizing properties. The formula includes the brand's proprietary ingredient, the JAUM Balancing Complex, which is a potent blend of five herbal ingredients carefully selected through an intricate process. These ingredients, including Peony, Sacred Lotus, Solomon's Seal, White Lily, and Rehmannia, work together to balance and rejuvenate the skin. reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've been a big fan of this brand for a while, and was grateful to receive this complimentary from Sulwhasoo. I had previously purchased this direct through Sulwhasoo, and the first thing I noticed upon receiving this product was that the packaging looked quite different. Upon further research, I discovered that the brand is claiming to have added boosting ingredients as well as added a focus on barrier support in comparison to the previous generation.  My experience with this product is lining up with these new claims. While I was initially worried about the alcohol/fragrance, my skin is responding well to this product with no irritation. As with the prior gen, I feel that my skincare is absorbing better when I start my routine with this serum. Finally, I am happy to report that I quickly saw results in terms of barrier boosting! My experience with ginseng/hanbang is that the full results will come in several weeks.  My final notes: Sulwhasoo is a brand wherein it is difficult to look at the INCI and conclusively state, oh it's THIS ingredient that is leading to these results! Instead, I believe this brand's entire formulas are responsible for the results. For this same reason, I don't believe it is helpful to write this off due to the fragrance/alcohol. Alcohol can be formulated into a gentle product, and fragrance can enhance the user experience. Overall, I think this brand and this product are formulated with great care for excellent results.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I love when products deliver a beautiful usage experience, and this Sulwhasoo First Care Activating Serum absolutely hit the spot. From the beautiful bottle to the grounding herbal medicine scent to the water-like texture, it’s a joy to use.  The scent is truly calming for me, breathing it in as part of my evening routine is a wonderful way to end the day. It’s very herbaceous and reminds me of an essential oil blend. On the bright side, the scent does dissipate quickly as the product melts into the skin.  The golden elixir is lightweight and runny; it melts quickly into the skin, dries to the touch within minutes, and leaves zero residue behind, which is a huge win. The brand recommends warming two to three pumps of the serum in your hands and gently pressing it into your cheeks, forehead, and nose until absorbed. It has a light texture and is almost like water, with an amber color.  It seems contradictory that adding an extra layer of skincare would help subsequent layers absorb better, but it works. My toner and serums seem to absorb quicker and leave less of a film when I use the Sulwhasoo activating serum. This was slightly harder to notice, but I’ve noticed that the rest of my products work harder when I use the Sulwhasoo serum.  My skin just feels more moisturized and has a bit more glow when I use this. I didn’t notice a difference in fine lines either way though. So if you’re in your 20’s, as I was when I first tried the Sulwhasoo Activating Serum, you’re going to be disappointed. But as we get older and our skin gets drier, duller, and more fine lines, this product can be just the boost your skincare routine needs.  Gifted by Sulwhasoo.

reviews.review_text: Don't trust people who haven't tried it.  Denatured alcohol is sometimes used in cosmetics and skincare products (such as toners) as a  It dries quickly, neutralizes oil, and gives your skin a smooth, matte feel. In small amounts, denatured alcohol is usually no problem in cosmetics unless it’s mixed with methanol, which can seep in through the skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I now unfortunately know from using this and having to wash it off within 5 minutes of using that the parfum being so high up on the ingredients list is a recipe for disaster, especially when paired with the high alcohol denat as well. Severe eye puffiness, skin itching and pain spreading through my chest meant that whatever they've includied in the parfum is too strong as I can use many products, including the concentrated renewing classic cream by this brand, with parfum low on the ingredients with no problem.  All I know is this confirms how high up the parfum is listed matters - no matter how expensive or good the other ingredients may be. For reference, I am topically allergic to lavender and react badly to essential oil/ natural fragrance - but parfum low on ingredient lists do not pose an issue for me. So it was not expected until experiencing this that the concentration of parfum would be the reacting factor. I use plenty of products with ingredients like this product otherwise, so it's a formulation issue for this product. Sadly disappointed by this.

reviews.review_text: Alcohol denat is listed as the second ingredient for this product, and it is not a moisturizing alcohol, it’s the type of alcohol that weakens your skin barrier and dry out your skin, meaning they rely on the alcohol to penetrate your skin barrier so other skincare products get absorbed better. So they don’t really have a magical or miracle or patented technology that’s unique to this product, it’s just the alcohol denat doing the job, which it weakens your skin barrier, in order to absorb other skincares… for a K beauty brand that existed for so long, and boasted about spending “decades of researches” to patent your technology/ingredients, you should be able to find a way to replace alcohol denat as a penetration agent. It’s sad that other Sulwhasoo products like the “Concentrated Ginseng Renewal Cream” and “Overnight Revitalization Mask” have fantastic ingredients and yield great results, their poster child “First Care Activation Serum”, couldn’t be bothered to find better ingredients/technology to replace alcohol denat… please do better, as a huge brand under Amorepacific, you have BILLIONS of dollars under your belt to do more researches, this is just sad and disappointing

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've been using this serum for over a year now and love it. I don't think it's necessarily a must-have but if you have the extra cash for both the experience and a product that does make a marginal difference in your skin's quality, this is the one.  It's my understanding that this serum helps soften the skin (this is also what this line's toner does) which increases the absorption of whatever other products you use. I cleanse, use a toner from another Korean brand, apply this serum then my vit c serum and so on. I can't speak to the anti-aging benefits and I also don't have any special circumstances when it comes to my skin (I'm not using tret and I have no acne or anything).  Like I said, it's not life-changing but I can definitely feel a difference when I don't use it. That much, I can say for sure.

reviews.review_title: Be careful if you use actives
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I have oily skin and use tretinoin to control acne. I began using the activating serum and a few months later when I was receiving a facial, my long-time aesthetician was shocked to see how dry my skin had become. She grilled me on what I was using and we suspect that the denatured alcohol in this was too much on top of the drying effect of tret. My skin was too dehydrated, no matter what I was piling on top to moisturize. She insisted that I stop immediately.

If you happen to enjoy its scent it’s something expensive to put on your face to feel luxurious with no additional benefits.

reviews.review_title: What the hype?! Ready for my bashing.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Since my mom was Korean, I was all about K beauty before it was a thing, and having a solid skincare ritual was drilled into me from an early age. After reading so many great reviews I was looking forward to trying this product. Something that would amplify the effects of my products? Heck, yeah. Sign me up. What a disappointment. After applying to clean skin, I was itchy almost immediately and blotchy with raised red bumps within moments. Apart from how this was a no go for my skin specifically, I wouldn’t have recommended it based on fragrance (earthy strange), texture (sticky tacky), consistency (didn’t spread evenly), and price ($$$). A solid skincare routine can stand on its own without an “activator.” It seems like a wasteful extra step.

reviews.review_text: I just received this yesterday from Influenster and I was shocked and so happy to receive four products from this brand. To be honest I had never heard of this brand until recently when Influenster let me know that I was going to be receiving these products but I am super happy that I did. The brand itself seems very high quality and almost luxurious in a sense. This serum feels like a special treat and I am so happy I got this. The consistency and texture of this serum felt great on my fingers and was super easy to apply to my face and skin. I was able to tell after putting it on that it made my skin feel softer to the touch which is a big plus of this product. The packaging is simple but beautiful and this brand I can tell is worth the money. What was also nice about this serum is that it wasn’t tacky like other serums have been that I have tried in the past. I know that this brand is a little more on the pricy side but I can tell why they charge what they do. Their products are high quality and make my skin noticeablely softer and it does what it is supposed to do!
